diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The final diagnosis of perforated diverticulitis was supported by the patient's symptoms of new abdominal pain following transfer, along with imaging findings from an abdominal CT that revealed sigmoid perforation with diffuse peritonitis. She also had elevated WBC count, indicating possible infection. Additional findings included focal tenderness in the left lower quadrant and a history of gastrointestinal symptoms such as diarrhea, fecal incontinence, and bright red blood on toilet paper.
